CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 5, 1957, page 8, reads: "Free Haircut and Shave - B. T. Blakey, seated, resident of the Aged Ministers and Laymen's Home, is shown receiving a free tonsorial service from Willis Clark, extreme right, through the courtesy of North Side Elks Lodge 124 and the Ideal School of Beauty recently. Look on are Mrs. Mamie Stewart, extreme left, superintendent of the home, and Wesley Davis, seated, second from left. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: B. T. Blakey recieving haircut from barber Willis Clark, with Mamie Stewart and Wesley Davis looking on, in bedroom of the Aged Ministers and Laymen's Home
